title: Angelique Rubio
text:
As a research assistant for UCLA’s Academic Advancement Program (AAP), I worked on multiple projects to assess the efficacy of various departments. These projects were intended to better understand the student experience and optimize the efficacy of various programs to maximize the retention of historically underrepresented students in higher education.
Evaluation of UCLA Academic Advancement Program (AAP) Freshman/Transfer Summer Program Exit Survey
Upon entering UCLA, AAP students are invited to attend a summer program the summer before their first year (for traditional students) or their third year (for transfer students). As a research assistant for the Research, Assesment and Evaluation (RAE) unit of AAP, I was tasked with reviewing survey data from over 100 student responses at the end of the program and producing an info graphic to illustrate the key takeaways from over 100 student responses.
Freshman/Transfer Summar Program Infographic

title: Angelique Rubio
text: I am currently pursuing a Bachelors of Science in Statistics and Data Science at the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA). Being a first-generation Latina dedicated to pursuing a STEM degree, I am actively searching for a company committed to prioritizing diversity in the tech sector and fostering equity in career advancement. My research at UCLA focused on individual retention rates for Latinas in STEM, igniting a deep passion for addressing the existing disparities within higher education and the tech industries. I am enthusiastically looking to align myself with a company that shares these values and is dedicated to rectifying the current imbalances for Latinas in these crucial fields. Attached is my current resume.
